alert.note: Alert for Litchfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 12:00AM EDT until July 13 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Housatonic River At Gaylordsville. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Moderate flood stage where water reaches Spring Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:31 PM EDT Monday the stage was 9.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.8 feet on 03/31/1993. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Housatonic River Gaylordsville Flood Stage: 8.0 Observed Stage at Mon 11 pm: 9.7 Forecast: Tue 2 am 9.9 Tue 8 am 9.4 Tue 2 pm 9.2 Tue 8 pm 8.9 Wed 2 am 8.8 Wed 8 am 8.6 Wed 2 pm 8.4 Wed 8 pm 8.1 Thu 2 am 7.9 Thu 8 am 7.6 Thu 2 pm MSG Thu 8 pm MSG &&
